alert.note: Alert for Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 5:14PM EDT until May 06 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, Mason and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mount Olivet, Sardis, US Route 62 at State Route 616, Abigail, Alhambra, Mitchells Mill, Burika, US Route 62 at State Route 875, Lowell, Piqua, Blue Licks Battlefield, Murphysville, Peed, Mays Lick, Kentontown and US Route 62 at State Route 19.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
